name: ITP - 138 - Texas Rail Installation ITP
template name: ITP - 138 - Texas Rail Installation ITP Rev D

name: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Methodology and ITP to be submitted to the Engineer and approved prior to works beginning
Verifying Document - Approved ITP on CONQA
Frequency - Submit 10 days prior to commencement of works
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Survey Set out as per contract drawings and specification, capturing pre-construction levels where needed.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Complete the Excavation permit process to identify, locate and protect all services.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Complete internal Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Hot works, concrete saw, lift, confined space, working at height etc.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Obtain External Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Close approach, Worksafe Notice etc.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Prior to starting works, Ensure that the construction drawings are both IFC and the Current Version.
SECTION 4 – MATERIAL, PERSONNEL & THIRD PARTY APPROVAL
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - All precast barrier QA to be in separate ITP for precast element. – This item to be acceptance of precast QA ITP
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Eclipse handrail QA to demonstrate compliance with Structural steel notes on IFC DWG 4001 (refer to fabrication ITP)
Standard / Specification - Structural steel notes on IFC DWG 4001

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Non-Conductive Barrier Coating to be Carboguard 636 XT (approved in RFI-0263), min. 150 microns to be applied to underside and side of baseplate (refer to fabrication ITP)
Verifying Document - Shop Drawing/Coating Certificate/delivery dockets

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Wire rope shall be 6mm stainless steel wire rope or otherwise approved; Material certs to demonstrate compliance of SS wire rope to be SS316 as per NZTA M23 Appendix B Rev.2
Standard / Specification - NZTA M23 Appendix B Rev.2 & NTT003
4.01.05 - M16 & M24 bolts, washers and nuts
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Property Class 8.8 Hold Down Bolts, HDG
4.01.06 - Sleeve Member and Pin on bottom of Sleeve, Base Plate and Rail Vertical Posts, Rail Termination Cap
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Material certs to demonstrate compliance with Structural steel notes on IFC DWG 4001 (refer to fabrication ITP)
Standard / Specification - Structural steel notes on IFC DWG 4001
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Material cert on U bolt or similar approved for safety wire rope termination detail
Standard / Specification - Structural steel notes on IFC DWG 4001
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Temporary works to be installed as per design drawings. Permit to load to be issued by temporary works inspector prior to loading element
Frequency - As defined in the temporary works design
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Re-check all bolt assemblies are Class 8.8 high strength unless otherwise specified on the drawings
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - As-built bolt locations, and overall alignment of precast barriers, for rail baseplate hole positioning. Set-out shims/packers
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Install vertical post with handrail and partly tension bolts onto the baseplate. Ensure tensioning tolerances for steelwork/bolts are checked.
Nominal diameter of bolt || Minimum bolt tension kN
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Check each bolt has a washer, nut and locknut and tension all bolts using part turn methodology
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - While Hi-ab is holding the handrail components, adjust/tighten, and apply Sika212 or similar (approved by Engineer) to the underside of the baseplate (nom. 15mm)

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Prior to installation make sure wire ropes are free from: wear or scraping, kinking, crushing, bird caging damages. Wire Rope to be installed within the following tolerance.
Unless specified otherwise in the system documentation of by the Road Authority, the following shall apply:

(a) Fittings such as swages, rigging screws and the like, shall be placed so that the end of the fitting is a minimum distance of 50 mm away from a post. In order to comply with Item (a), the requirements to avoid clashes with fittings, it is permissible to move the location of a post.
(b) Variation from the true plan position of posts ±30 mm.
(d) Variation from true plan position of barrier ±20 mm.
(f) Anchor blocks (length, width and depth) -20, +100 mm.
(g) Height of footing relative to finished surface levels +20, -0mm.
(h) The system shall be tensioned to a tolerance of ±1.0 kN.
(i) All anchors, footings and posts shall be capable of resisting the load nominated by the System Supplier (see Clause 2.5.4).
(j) Upon completion of the installation, the wire rope shall be free of creases or fracture strands and the galvanizing undamaged.
SECTION 6 – POST CONSTRUCTION (FINAL INSPECTION AND HANDOVER)

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Compile construction records for final submission ensuring defects (NCRs) / Snags / missing records are captured or closed out, all tests have been received and passed, and changes / omissions have been noted.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Ensure all items have been surveyed and records are assembled for asbuilting

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Create a set of Redline Drawings for Asbuilt creation noting all changes and departures in red pen. Red line to show any changes to footpath location or basecourse depth.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Update the project Defect, Snag and Punch List Register
